abstract: Notifies the cell that it’s about to transition to a new cell state.
overview:
## Discussion

Subclasses of `UITableViewCell` can implement this method to animate additional changes to a cell when it is changing state. `UITableViewCell` calls this method whenever a cell transitions between states, such as from a normal state (the default) to editing mode. The custom cell can set up and position any new views that appear with the new state. The cell then receives a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/layoutSubviews()] message (`UIView`) in which it can position these new views in their final locations for the new state. Subclasses must always call `super` when overriding this method.

Note that when the user swipes a cell to delete it, the cell transitions to the state identified by the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/StateMask/showingDeleteConfirmation] constant but the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/StateMask/showingEditControl] is not set.

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/willTransition(to:)
crawled: 2025-12-03T18:29:14Z
---

# willTransition(to:)

**Instance Method**

Notifies the cell that it’s about to transition to a new cell state.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func willTransition(to state: UITableViewCell.StateMask)
```

## Parameters

- **state**: A bit mask indicating the state or combination of states the cell is transitioning to.

## Discussion

Subclasses of `UITableViewCell` can implement this method to animate additional changes to a cell when it is changing state. `UITableViewCell` calls this method whenever a cell transitions between states, such as from a normal state (the default) to editing mode. The custom cell can set up and position any new views that appear with the new state. The cell then receives a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/layoutSubviews()] message (`UIView`) in which it can position these new views in their final locations for the new state. Subclasses must always call `super` when overriding this method.

Note that when the user swipes a cell to delete it, the cell transitions to the state identified by the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/StateMask/showingDeleteConfirmation] constant but the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/StateMask/showingEditControl] is not set.

## Related Documentation

- **editingAccessoryType**: The type of standard accessory view for the cell to use in the table view’s editing state.
- **editingAccessoryView**: The view to use on the right side of the cell, typically as a control, in the table view’s editing state.
- **accessoryView**: The view to use on the right side of the cell, typically as a control, in the table view’s normal state.
- **accessoryType**: The type of standard accessory view for the cell to use in the table view’s normal state.

## Adjusting to state transitions

- **didTransition(to:)**: Notifies the cell that it transitioned to a new cell state.
- **UITableViewCell.StateMask**: Constants used to determine the new state of a cell as it transitions between states.
